com.persistit
Class Volume

java.lang.Object
  com.persistit.Volume

public class Volume
extends Object

Represent the identity and optionally the service classes that manage a volume. A newly constructed Volume is "hollow" in the sense that it has no ability to perform I/O on a backing file or allocate pages. In this state it represents the identity, but not the content, of the volume.

To enable the Volume to act on data, you must supply a VolumeSpecification object, either through the constructor or with setSpecification(com.persistit.VolumeSpecification), and then call the open(Persistit) method.

Author:
peter

Method Detail

isValidPageSize

public static boolean isValidPageSize(int pageSize)

close

public void close()
           throws PersistitException
Release all resources for this Volume and invalidate all its buffers in the BufferPool. Exchanges based on this Volume may no longer be used after this call. Waits up to 60000L milliseconds for other threads to relinquish access to the volume.

Throws:
PersistitException

close

public void close(long timeout)
           throws PersistitException
Release all resources for this Volume and invalidate all its buffers in the BufferPool. Exchanges based on this Volume may no longer be used after this call.

Parameters:
timeout - Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for other threads to relinquish access to the volume.
Throws:
PersistitException

truncate

public void truncate()
              throws PersistitException
Remove all data from this volume. This is equivalent to deleting and then recreating the Volume except that it does not actually delete and close the file. Instead, this method truncates the file, rewrites the head page, and invalidates all buffers belonging to this Volume in the BufferPool.

Throws:
PersistitException

delete

public boolean delete()
               throws PersistitException
Delete the file backing this Volume.

Returns:
true if the file existed and was successfully deleted.
Throws:
PersistitException

getNextAvailablePage

public long getNextAvailablePage()
Returns:
page address of the first unused page in this Volume

getExtendedPageCount

public long getExtendedPageCount()
Returns:
number of pages allocated to this Volume. Note that this method reflects the current length of the volume file, but on sparse file systems the disk space needed to store new pages may not yet have been allocated.

getPageSize

public int getPageSize()
Returns:
The size in bytes of one page in this Volume.

getTree

public Tree getTree(String name,
                    boolean createIfNecessary)
             throws PersistitException
Looks up by name and returns a NewTree within this Volume. If no such tree exists, this method either creates a new tree or returns null depending on whether the createIfNecessary parameter is true.

Parameters:
name - The tree name
createIfNecessary - Determines whether this method will create a new tree if there is no tree having the specified name.
Returns:
The NewTree, or null if createIfNecessary is false and there is no such tree in this Volume.
Throws:
PersistitException

                      throws PersistitException

The array
Throws:
PersistitException
